sections.content:
This module offers functionalities akin to a notebook page.

The primary entry point is  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) , which serves as a wrapper for parsing markdown content.
The markdown source can contain a series of executable cells, including  [JsCellView](@nav/api/Notebook.JsCellView)  and  [MdCellView](@nav/api/Notebook.MdCellView) .
These cells are identified within the markdown source using specific DOM elements ( `js-cell` ,  `md-cell` ),
and their attributes are passed to the corresponding constructors (refer to  [JsCellAttributes](@nav/api/Notebook.JsCellAttributes)  and
 [MdCellAttributes](@nav/api/Notebook.MdCellAttributes)  for details).

Most of the implementation logic regarding synchronization are included in the  [State](@nav/api/Notebook.State)  class.
Default values for  [CellCommonAttributes](@nav/api/Notebook.CellCommonAttributes) .
Represents the view of a cell's header.
Classes associated to the view.
Represents the tag of a  [CellView](@nav/api/Notebook.CellView)  (read-only or not, the language, *etc.*).
Classes associated to the view.

public readonly class =

sections.content: Style associated to the view.

Represents the view of a cell.
It includes:
*  An  [header](@nav/api/Notebook.CellHeaderView) .
*  The  [code editor](@nav/api/Notebook.SnippetEditorView) .
*  The  [outputs container](@nav/api/Notebook.OutputsView) .
Classes associated to the view.
Represents a deported output view (instantiated from  `cell-output`  element).
Classes associated to the view.

Represents the view of a cell that will render once the associated cell is registered in the  [State](@nav/api/Notebook.State) .
Upon registration, this container includes one child of type  [CellView](@nav/api/Notebook.CellView) .
Classes associated to the view.

Represents the execution side of a Javascript cell within a  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) .

This implementation does not provide the views (editor, outputs), it is used as it is when loading separated notebook
pages to retrieve exported symbols.
However, this implementation is typically inherited from  [JsCellView](@nav/api/Notebook.JsCellView)  to provide the regular views of
a javascript cell.
Cell unique ID.
Initial source code.
Observable over the source content of the cell.
Emit when the cell is invalidated.
State manager, owned by the parent  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) .
Execute the cell. See  [execute](@nav/api/Notebook.JsCellExecutor.execute) .

sections.content:
Represents a Markdown cell within a  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) .

They are typically included from a DOM definition with tag name  `md-cell` , in this case
associated attributes are provided as DOM attributes; see  [CellCommonAttributes](@nav/api/Notebook.CellCommonAttributes) .
Cell unique ID.
Classes associated to the view.
Observable over the source content of the cell.
State manager, owned by the parent  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) .
Execute the cell. Because markdown cell can include other cells, this function own a dedicated  [State](@nav/api/Notebook.State) ).

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **args**: See  [ExecArgs](@nav/api/Notebook.ExecArgs) .

code.declaration:
async execute({
        scope,
        owningState,
        cellId,
        src,
        output$,
    }: ExecArgs): Promise<Scope>
export class MdCellView implements VirtualDOM<'div'>, CellTrait

sections.content:
Represents a page of a notebook.

A notebook page is a markdown content including definition of executable cells
(*e.g.*  [JsCellView](@nav/api/Notebook.JsCellView) ,  [MdCellView](@nav/api/Notebook.MdCellView) ) as well as other related components.

Cells run in the order of inclusion, and share their top level scope.
Classes associated to the view.
Initial scope provided to the first executing cell.
State manager.
Constructs the page.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **params**: The parameters
*  **initialScope**: Initial scope provided to the first executing cell.
*  **options**: Global options for the page, in particular defined the default attribute for the various
cells.
*  **router**: Application's router.
*  **src**: Markdown source content. To fetch from a URL leave it empty & provide instead
the  `url`  attribute.
*  **url**: Url pointing to the markdown content, only used if the  `src`  attribute is not provided.

code.declaration:
constructor(params: {
        url?: string
        src?: string
        router: Router
        initialScope?: Partial<Scope>
        options?: NotebookOptions
    })

Represents the execution side of a Python cell within a  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) .

This implementation does not provide the views (editor, outputs), it is used as it is when loading separated notebook
pages to retrieve exported symbols.
However, this implementation is typically inherited from  [PyCellView](@nav/api/Notebook.PyCellView)  to provide the regular views of
a python cell.
The provided attributes.

Execute the cell. See  [executePy](undefined) .

sections.content: The application router, used to import modules from other notebook pages.
Observables over the cell's entering scopes keyed by the cell's ID.
Observables over the cell's source keyed by the cell's ID.
Trait for a Cell within a  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) .
Cell unique ID.
Observable over the source content of the cell.
Define the implementation of cell execution.

The common set for attributes of a notebook cell.

When provided from a DOM element in the markdown source, they are defined using kebab case:
 ```
<some-cell line-numbers='true' read-only='false'></some-cell>
```
Arguments used to execute a cell, see  [CellTrait.execute](@nav/api/Notebook.CellTrait.execute) .

code.declaration:
export type ExecArgs = {
    /**
     * Cell ID.
     */
    cellId: string
    /**
     * Source to execute.
     */
    src: string

    /**
     * The function used to load a submodule from a notebook page.
     *
     * @param path Navigation path of the submodule.
     * @returns The exported symbols.
     */
    load: (path: string) => Promise<{ [k: string]: unknown }>

    /**
     * Subject in which output (*e.g.* when using  display` in a {@link JsCellView}) are sent.
     */
    output$: Subject<Output>
    /**
     * Owning state of the cell.
     */
    owningState: State
    /**
     * Entering scope of the cell.
     */
    scope: Scope
}

sections.content: All attributes available for a javascript cell: the common ones + 'reactive'.
All attributes available for a Markdown cell are the common ones for now.
Global options for a  [NotebookPage](@nav/api/Notebook.NotebookPage) .

Type of the outputs generated by a cell.

The type  `undefined`  is a signal to clear the outputs displayed.
All attributes available for a python cell are the common ones for now.

Represents the scope of a cell.

This is a work in progress: at least functions and classes are missing.
Execute a given javascript source content.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **invalidated$**: Observable that emits when the associated cell is invalidated.
*  **load**: The function used to load a submodule from another notebook page.
*  **output$**: Subject in which output views are sent (when using  `display`  function).
*  **reactive**: If true, observables & promises are resolved before cell execution using a  `combineLatest` 
policy.
*  **scope**: The entering scope.
*  **src**: The source to execute

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: Promise over the scope at exit

code.declaration:
export async function executeJs({
    src,
    scope,
    output$,
    load,
    reactive,
    invalidated$,
}: {
    src: string
    scope: Scope
    output$: Subject<AnyVirtualDOM>
    load: (path: string) => Promise<{ [k: string]: unknown }>
    reactive?: boolean
    invalidated$: Observable<unknown>
}): Promise<Scope>

sections.content: Execute a given javascript statement. This execution is reactive by default.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **invalidated$**: Observable that emits when the associated cell is invalidated.
*  **output$**: Subject in which output views are sent (when using  `display`  function).
*  **scope**: The entering scope.
*  **src**: The source to execute

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: Promise over the scope at exit
